notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning. A number of pages partially damaged; large signs of book-worming.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A Judeo-Arabic commentary on the Hafṭarot of Exodus.

collation.p: 5 quires of 10 leaves. Quires signed with Hebrew letters on the first and last pages.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square and semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of approximately 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Comm. on Hafṭaroth. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Or. 2583.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [51v].
